alert.note: Alert for Berkshire; Franklin (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 9:00AM EST until December 19 at 1:15AM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Massachusetts... West Deerfield River AT West Deerfield affecting Franklin County. Deerfield At Charlemont affecting Berkshire and Franklin Counties. For the Deerfield River...including Charlemont, West Deerfield... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deerfield at Charlemont. * WHEN...From this afternoon to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, In Charlemont, floodwaters inundate low lying farmland adjacent to the Deerfield River. Floodwaters also encroach on lowest lying structures near the River near West Hawley Road and Route 2. Floodwaters inundate the lowest lying roadway in the Mohawk Park Campground, and encroach on lowest lying structures off of Zoar Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM EST Monday the stage was 6.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 10.6 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 11/26/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM EST.
